sen.j: 四条畷 - 新木津・木津間は、その頃、大阪進出を計画していた関西鉄道が1897年に浪速鉄道とともに合併した城河鉄道から四条畷 - 長尾 - 木津間の鉄道敷設免許を譲り受け、翌1898年に開通させたものである。
sen.e: The line between Shijonawate, Shin-Kizu and Kizu was opened in 1898 by Kansai Railway which in those days planned to gain ground in Osaka and got the Railway Construction License for the line between Shijonawate, Nagao and Kizu from Joga Railway merging with Naniwa Railway in 1897.

sen.j: 関西鉄道は網島 - 四条畷 - 新木津間を名阪間を結ぶ本線とし、網島 - 名古屋間に四条畷経由で直通列車を運転するが、1900年に大阪鉄道を合併して名阪間の本線を王寺経由に変更、さらに加茂 - 奈良間を大仏経由から木津経由に変更した1907年より後は、木津 - 桜ノ宮・片町間を結ぶだけのローカル線となった。
sen.e: Kansai Railway considered the line between Amijima, Shijonawate and Shin-Kizu as the main line which connects Nagoya and Osaka, and the direct trains ran between Amijima and Nagoya through Shijonawate, but in 1900 Kansai Railway merged with Osaka Railway and changed the main line between Nagoya and Osaka to the one through Oji and furthermore, after 1907 when the line between Kamo and Nara through Daibutsu was changed to the one through Kizu, there remained only the local line between Kizu, Sakuranomiya and Katamachi.

sen.j: 1932年、四条畷 - 片町間が関西の国電区間では初めて電化され（1929年に開通した阪和線は当時阪和電気鉄道という私鉄）、木津 - 四条畷間は国鉄C11形蒸気機関車が牽引する蒸気機関車、四条畷 - 片町間は電車になった。
sen.e: In 1932 the line between Shijonawate and Katamachi was electrified firstly in the sections of JNR in Kansai area (Hanwa Line opened in 1929 was, in those days, the private railroad company called Hanwa Electric Railway) and the steam locomotives towed by JNR steam locomotive C11 class [Type C11] ran between Kizu and Shijonawate, and the electric trains ran between Shijonawate and Katamachi.

sen.j: 戦前の当路線の特色として、大日本帝国陸軍大阪砲兵工廠（現在の大阪ビジネスパークの地にあった）と沿線に設置された工廠や火薬庫を結ぶ軍需輸送がある。
sen.e: The characteristics of the line in the prewar era was the transportation for military demand, linking Osaka Artillery Arsenal, Imperial Japanese Army (located in the place of the present-day Osaka Business Park) with the arsenals and magazines located along the line.

sen.j: 戦後、施設の廃止により香里と中宮に至る専用線は道路化されたが、戦後に米軍および自衛隊の施設に転用された祝園の専用線はその後も使われ、現在もその跡をわずかに留めている。
sen.e: After the war, the abolition of the facilities caused the exclusive line leading to Kori and Nakamiya to be the road, but the exclusive line in Housono, which was converted for the facilities of US forces and Self Defense Force after the war, was used afterward too and a bit of the remnant still remains.

sen.j: 戦後の1949年には、四条畷 - 片町間22分間隔、所要34分のところを20分間隔、所要昼間22分、朝夕24 - 26分に増発・スピードアップされた。
sen.e: In 1949 after the war, the trains ran between Shijonawate and Katamachi every 22 minutes and the required time was 34 minutes, but they ran more frequently and faster every 20 minutes and the required time in the daytime was 22 minutes and the one in the morning and evening was 24 to 26 minutes.

sen.e: - By division and privatization of JNR, West Japan Railway Company succeeded it.
- After the division and privatization of JNR, West Japan Railway Company succeeded it.
After the division and privatization of JNR, West Japan Railway Company succeeded it.

sen.j: 日本貨物鉄道が一部区間の第二種鉄道事業者となる。
sen.e: Japan Freight Railway Company became 2nd class railway operator of some sections.
Japan Freight Railway Company became a second class railway operator of some sections.
Japan Freight Railway Company became a second class railway operator of some sections.

sen.j: 木津 - 徳庵間の貨物営業廃止。
sen.e: The freight commercial operation between Kizu and Tokuan was abolished.
Commercial freight operations between Kizu and Tokuan were abolished.
Commercial freight operations between Kizu and Tokuan were abolished.

sen.j: 放出 - 八尾間、鴫野 - 吹田間が戸籍上旅客営業開始。
sen.e: As an official registry the passenger commercial operation started between Hanaten and Yao, and between Shigino and Suita.
As an official registry the passenger commercial operation started between Hanaten and Yao, and between Shigino and Suita.
As an official registry the passenger commercial operation started between Hanaten and Yao, and between Shigino and Suita.

sen.j: - 学研都市線の愛称使用開始。
sen.e: - The nickname of Gakkentoshi Line started to be used.
- The nickname, Gakkentoshi Line, started to be used.
The nickname, Gakkentoshi Line, started to be used.

sen.j: 快速列車の運行開始（当初は平日のみ上り1本・下り2本。）
sen.e: The rapid trains started to run (originally on weekdays, the number of the up line was one and the down line two.
Rapid trains started to run (originally on weekdays, the number of the up line was one and the down line, two.
Rapid trains started to run (originally on weekdays, the number of the up line was one and the down line, two.)

sen.j: （停車駅：長尾・四条畷・住道・放出・京橋・片町）。
sen.e: The stops : Nagao, Shijonawate, Suminodo, Hanaten, Kyobashi and Katamachi).
The stops: Nagao, Shijonawate, Suminodo, Hanaten, Kyobashi and Katamachi.)
(The stops: Nagao, Shijonawate, Suminodo, Hanaten, Kyobashi and Katamachi.)

sen.j: - 河内磐船駅が快速停車駅になる。
sen.e: - Kawachiiwafune station became the stop for rapid trains.
- Kawachiiwafune station became a stop for rapid trains.
Kawachiiwafune Station became a stop for rapid trains.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除用語統一

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）
- 木津 - 長尾間が電化。
sen.e: - The line between Kizu and Nagao was electrified.
- The line between Kizu and Nagao was electrified.
The line between Kizu and Nagao was electrified.

sen.j: 大住 - 長尾間が経路変更で0.1km短縮、同区間に松井山手駅が開業、松井山手 - 長尾間複線化。
sen.e: The line between Osumi and Nagao was shortened (0.1 km) because of the route change and on the section Matsuiyamate station opened and the line between Matsuiyamate and Nagao became a double line.
The line between Osumi and Nagao was shortened (0.1 km) because of the route change and on the section Matsuiyamate station opened and the line between Matsuiyamate and Nagao became a double line.
The line between Osumi and Nagao was shortened (0.1 km) because of the route change and on the section Matsuiyamate Station opened and the line between Matsuiyamate and Nagao became a double line.

sen.j: 快速列車を大幅増発。
sen.e: The rapid trains increased extremely.
The number of rapid trains greatly increased.
The number of rapid trains greatly increased.

sen.j: 6月頃、片町線から101系電車が撤退（7両編成を6両編成化した上で森ノ宮電車区に転属し、桜島線や大阪環状線で1991年まで運用）。
sen.e: Around June, JNR Series 101 retired from Katamachi Line (7-car train sets were changed to 6-car train sets and instead they came to belong to Morinomiya train section and ran on Sakurajima Line or Osaka Loop Line until 1991).

Around June, JNR Series 101 retired from Katamachi Line (seven-car train s were changed to six-car trains and they came to belong to the Morinomiya train section and ran on the Sakurajima Line or the Osaka Loop Line until 1991).

Around June, JNR Series 101 retired from Katamachi Line (seven-car trains were changed to six-car trains and they came to belong to the Morinomiya train section and ran on the Sakurajima Line or the Osaka Loop Line until 1991).

sen.j: - 207系電車営業運転開始
sen.e: - JNR Series 207 started to run commercially.
- JNR Series 207 started to run commercially.
JNR Series 207 started to run commercially.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）9月 片町線から103系電車が引退（片町線103系は大阪環状線、大和路線、奈良線、阪和線等に転属され、一部は後に3500番台として播但線へも転用された）。
sen.e: In September 1996, JNR Series 103 retired from Katamachi Line (the Series 103 on Katamachi Line came to belong to Osaka Loop Line, Yamatoji Line, Nara Line and Hanwa Line and later some of them were transferred to Bantan Line as the number 3500s).

In September 1996, JNR Series 103 retired from the Katamachi Line (the Series 103 on Katamachi Line came to belong to the Osaka Loop Line, Yamatoji Line, Nara Line, and Hanwa Line and later some of them were transferred to the Bantan Line as number 3500s).

In September 1996, JNR Series 103 retired from the Katamachi Line (the Series 103 on Katamachi Line came to belong to the Osaka Loop Line, Yamatoji Line, Nara Line, and Hanwa Line and later some of them were transferred to the Bantan Line as number 3500s).

sen.j: - JR東西線開業により、JR宝塚線・JR神戸線との直通運転を開始。
sen.e: - When JR Tozai line opened, the direct lines to JR Takarazuka Line and JR Kobe Line started to run.
- When JR Tozai line opened, direct lines to JR Takarazuka Line and JR Kobe Line started to run.
When JR Tozai line opened, direct lines to JR Takarazuka Line and JR Kobe Line started to run.

sen.j: 京橋 - 片町間 (0.5km) 廃止。
sen.e: The line between Kyobashi and Katamachi (0.5 km) was abolished.
The line between Kyobashi and Katamachi (0.5 km) was abolished.
The line between Kyobashi and Katamachi (0.5 km) was abolished.

sen.j: 片町駅廃止。
sen.e: Katamachi station was abolished.
Katamachi station was abolished.
Katamachi Station was abolished.

sen.j: 田辺駅を京田辺駅、上田辺駅をJR三山木駅に改称。
sen.e: Tanabe station was changed to Kyotanabe station and Kamitanabe station to JR Miyamaki station.
Tanabe station was changed to Kyotanabe station and Kamitanabe station to JR Miyamaki station.
Tanabe Station was changed to Kyotanabe Station and Kamitanabe Station to JR Miyamaki Station.

sen.j: - 区間快速の運転開始。
sen.e: - Regional rapid trains started to run.
- Regional rapid trains started to run.
Regional rapid trains started to run.

sen.j: - 京都府や京田辺市などの負担で京田辺 - 松井山手間の高速化事業完成。
sen.e: - The project of speed-up of the line between Kyotanabe and Matsuiyamate was completed by Kyoto prefecture and Kyotanabe city and so on.
- The speed-up project for the line between Kyotanabe and Matsuiyamate was completed by Kyoto prefecture and Kyotanabe city and so on.
The speed-up project for the line between Kyotanabe and Matsuiyamate was completed by Kyoto Prefecture and Kyotanabe City and so on.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除用語統一

sen.j: 増解結駅が松井山手駅から京田辺駅に変更となる。
sen.e: The station, where the train car sets are connected or disconnected, was changed from Matsuiyamate station to Kyotanabe station.
The station, where the train car sets are connected or disconnected, was changed from Matsuiyamate station to Kyotanabe station.
The station, where the train car sets are connected or disconnected, was changed from Matsuiyamate station to Kyotanabe station.

sen.j: 同時に星田駅が快速停車駅になる。
sen.e: At the same time Hoshida station became a stop for rapid trains.
At the same time Hoshida station became a stop for rapid trains.
At the same time Hoshida Station became a stop for rapid trains.

sen.j: - 貨物支線の蛇草信号場廃止。
sen.e: - Hagusa signal station on freight feeder line was abolished.
- Hagusa signal station on the freight feeder line was abolished.
Hagusa signal station on the freight feeder line was abolished.

sen.j: - 321系電車営業運転開始。
sen.e: - JNR Series 321 started to run commercially.
- JNR Series 321 started to run commercially.
JNR Series 321 started to run commercially.

sen.j: - 貨物支線 放出 - 八尾間 (10.4km) 廃止（おおさか東線開業のため）。
sen.e: - The freight feeder line between Hanaten and Yao (10.4 km) was abolished (because of the opening of Osaka Higashi Line).
- The freight feeder line between Hanaten and Yao (10.4 km) was abolished (because of the opening of the Osaka Higashi Line).
The freight feeder line between Hanaten and Yao (10.4 km) was abolished (because of the opening of the Osaka Higashi Line).

sen.j: 平野側の貨物支線は片町線のまま存続するため、おおさか東線からの分岐点に正覚寺信号場（3代目）を新設して、正覚寺信号場 - 平野間を片町線所属の支線とする。
sen.e: As the freight feeder line on Hirano side continued as Katamachi Line, Shogakuji signal station (the third) was newly established at the bifurcation point from Osaka Higashi Line and the line between Shogakuji signal station and Hirano was treated as the branch line belonging to Katamachi Line.

As the freight feeder line on the Hirano side continued as the Katamachi Line, Shogakuji signal station (the third) was newly established at the bifurcation point from Osaka Higashi Line and the line between Shogakuji signal station and Hirano was treated as a branch line belonging to Katamachi Line.

As the freight feeder line on the Hirano side continued as the Katamachi Line, Shogakuji signal station (the third) was newly established at the bifurcation point from Osaka Higashi Line and the line between Shogakuji signal station and Hirano was treated as a branch line belonging to Katamachi Line.

sen.j: 普通列車は全駅に停車する（表中では省略）。
sen.e: The local trains stop at all the stations (omitted in the list).
The local trains stop at all the stations (omitted in the list).
The local trains stop at all the stations (omitted in the list).

sen.j: 凡例

Explanatory note

sen.j: 駅名 … ◇：貨物取扱駅（定期貨物列車の発着なし）、：特定都区市内「大阪市内」の駅
sen.e: The name of stations … ◇: freight-handling station (no departure and arrival of a regular freight train), : the station in special urban area "in Osaka city"
sen.cmt: 「特定都区市内」が不明で、とりあえず、special urban area としました。
sen.e: The name of stations … ◇: freight-handling station (no departure and arrival of a regular freight train), : the station in special urban area "in Osaka city"
The name of stations … <>: freight-handling station (no departure and arrival of a regular freight train), : the station in special urban area 'in Osaka City'

sen.j: 停車駅 … ●：停車、｜：通過
sen.e: The stop … ● : stop, ｜: passing
The stop … ● : stop, ｜: passing
The stop … (1): stop,|: passing

sen.j: 単線／複線 … ∥：複線区間、◇：単線区間（列車交換可能）、｜：単線区間（列車交換不可）、▽：木津方面同士の列車交換不可、∧：ここより下は複線
sen.e: Single line/double line … ∥: double line section, ◇: single line section (the interchange of trains is impossible), ▽: the interchange of trains for Kizu area is impossible, ∧: the down below from here is doubl line.

Single line/double line … ∥: double line section, ◇: single line section (the interchange of trains is impossible), ▽: the interchange of trains for Kizu area is impossible, ∧: the down below from here is doubl line.

Single line/double line...//: double line section, <>: single line section (the interchange of trains is possible),|: single line section (the interchange of trains is impossible), (2): the interchange of trains for Kizu area is impossible, (3): the down below from here is double line.

sen.j: 全駅・信号場とも大阪府に所在。
sen.e: Both of all the stations and signal stations are located in Osaka prefecture.
Both of all the stations and signal stations are located in Osaka prefecture.
Both of all the stations and signal stations are located in Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 2009年度末までに木津駅から同志社前駅までの各駅のホームを延長し、全区間7両編成で運転すると発表されている。
sen.e: It is announced that until the end of the year 2009 the platforms of each station between Kizu station and Doshishamae station will be extended and 7-car train sets will run on all the sections.
sen.cmt: 「2009年度末」は、すでに過去ですが、和文に忠実に英訳しました。
sen.e: It has been announced that until the end of the year 2009, platforms at each station between Kizu station and Doshishamae station will be extended and seven-car trains will run on all sections.
